clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II Study of Chemoradiotherapy Using Albumin-Bound Paclitaxel and Cisplatin in Unresectable Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinomas Based on Nutritional Risk Screening Score (NRS2002)

brief_summary.textblock: This phase I/II clinical study is designed to evaluate the 1 year local tumor control rate of chemoradiotherapy using albumin-bound paclitaxel and cisplatin in unresectable esophageal squamous cell carcinomas based on Nutritional Risk Screening NRS2002.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year from the start of treatment to tumor recurrence
primary_outcome.description: Control rate of primary esophageal cancer and metastatic lymph nodes within irradiation fields

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with acute toxicities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 week, from the start of treatment to 1 month after chemoradiotherapy
secondary_outcome.description: Acute toxicities are evaluated by NCI-CTC version 5.0
Objective Response Rate are evaluated by RECIST 1.1
Radiomics analysis for tumor response and survival prediction with pre- and post-chemoradiotherapy based on MRI and CT simulation
ctDNA analysis to monitor therapeutic efficacy including tumor response and survival outcome

arm_group.arm_group_label: Albumin-Bound Paclitaxel and Cisplatin based chemoradiotherapy
arm_group.description: Chemoradiotherapy arm receives intensity-modulated radiation therapy, volume modulated arc therapy or tomotherapy concurrently with albumin-bound paclitaxel and cisplatin (weekly intravenous infusion in 5-6 weeks).

intervention.description: 59.92Gy and 2.14Gy in 28 fractions to PGTV and 50.4Gy and 1.8Gy in 28 fractions 5 days every week in 5.5 weeks.
intervention.arm_group_label: Albumin-Bound Paclitaxel and Cisplatin based chemoradiotherapy

intervention.description: 100mg/d weekly,repeatedly on the first day,by intravenous infusion in 5-6 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18~75 years
- Pathologically or cytologically proven unresectable esophageal squamous cell carcinomas in patients staged as T3N1M0-1b and T4N0-1M0-1b(AJCC 6th TNM staging,M1b limited to clavicular or celiac lymph node metastasis)
- Primary treatment performed in Cancer Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences
- ECOG PS score: 0~1
- NRS2002 score <3
- Estimated survival time â‰¥3 months
- Normal organ and marrow function as defined below:
Hemoglobin: greater than or equal to 100g/L ;Leukocytes: greater than or equal to 4,000 G/L; Neutrophil: greater than or equal to 2,000 G/L; Platelets: greater than or equal to 100,000/mm3 ; Creatinine: less than or equal to 1.5 times the upper limit or CCR greater than or equal to 60 ml/min; AST/ALT: less than or equal to 2.5 times the upper limit; Total bilirubin: less than or equal to 1.5 times the upper limit; INR: less than or equal to 1.5 times the upper limit; APTT: less than or equal to 1.5 times the upper limit; PT: less than or equal to 1.5 times the upper limit
- Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- With any distant metastasis out of regional lymphatic drainage or in liver, lung, bone, CNS, etc
- Patients with other cancer history in 5 years except cervical carcinoma in situ and non-malignant melanoma skin cancer
- Existing active infection such as active tuberculosis and hepatitis
- History of myocardial infarction within the past 6 months or history of ventricular arrhythmia
- Uncontrolled illness including, but not limited to, active infection, symptomatic heart failure, unstable angina pectoris, cardiac arrhythmia, or psychiatric illness
- History of allergic reactions attributed to paclitaxel, albumin or cisplatin
- Participation in other clinical trials currently or within 4 weeks of selection
- Pregnant or lactating females
